review: Well, its much cheaper than my local satellite providers monthly bill.  You're not going to be able to get your favorite channels live of course and some of the programs have ads.  However, those that do have ads are approx. a minute, more or less.  Big deal.  Its still better than 5, 6, or 7 minute ads four times within 30 minutes.  Most of the present TV programs are just mind dumbing so I don't miss them at all.  There is plenty of good content available with Roku.  Sports, travel, cooking, movies.  If you want to spend .99 cents you can bypass the ads or for a couple of bucks a month you can access your favorite shows.
